PyPoints¶

A curses-based python module. Each character on the terminal is a point. This module give you tools to use to build these points

class pypoints.Blueprint(file, nofile=False)¶

Bases: object

Allows you to draw custom objects and fully customize objects like MenuBox and Text. It uses a json file or string to load the Blueprint. Can drawn with Shape

Parameters

  • file (string) – The file name of the file. If nofile is True, then it is the json string

  • nofile (bool) – (default False) If True, file is interpreted as a string

class pypoints.Color(fg, bg)¶

Bases: object

A color definition used for Font. PyPoints has variables that you can use for this. The colors are black, blue, cyan, green, magenta, red, white, and yellow

Parameters

  • fg (byte) – The foreground color

  • bg (byte) – The background color

Example

color = Color(black, yellow)

See also

Font

class pypoints.ColorGet¶

Bases: object

A PyPoints registry class that is used to register curses color numbers.

Warning

Do not use this class. It is an internal usage class only

get()¶
class pypoints.Font(color, extra=None)¶

Bases: object

Used to make a Point with custom colors and display

Parameters

  • color (Color) – The color of the text

  • extra (byte) – (optional) Extra text display types. PyPoints supports bold, dim, reverse, standout, and underline. These types are available as variables in the module

Example

color = Color(green, blue)
font = Font(color, bold)
point = Point("a", 0, 0, 0, font)

Warning

Do not change font.regid. Blueprints using that font will fail. Keep in mind that the order of the font definition determines its regid. If using blueprints, don’t change the order of your fonts

See also

Color, Point, Blueprint

export()¶

Exports font to file “font<regid>.pk” as a pickle file. It can be unpickled with the pickle module.

Example

font.export()

Note

To get regid, use font.regid, or look at the order of your fonts. First one gets 0, and so on

See also

FontRegistry

class pypoints.FontRegistry¶

Bases: object

A PyPoints registry class that is used to register Font

Warning

Do not use this class. It is an internal usage class only

get(font)¶
register(font)¶
class pypoints.HLine(sx, ex, y, char, cfield, font=None)¶

Bases: object

Makes a horizontal line

Parameters

  • sx (int) – Start x

  • ex (int) – End x

  • y (int) – y position

  • char (string) – The character that the line consists of

  • cfield (int) – The field the line appears

  • font (Font) – (optional) The font of the points in the line

Example

HLine(1, 7, 1, "-", 0)

See also

VLine

build()¶

There is no need to use this method. It is run automatically

remove(kill=False)¶

Removes all points in the line

Parameters

kill (bool) – (optional) (default False) Deletes the line. Any subsequent calls or references to the line will fail because the line no longer exists.

Warning

This action is irreversable

See also

Point.remove()

pypoints.IncompatibleBlueprintType(Exception)¶

An error that is called when the wrong blueprint is given to a blueprint using function

See also

Blueprint, Shape

class pypoints.MenuBox(x, y, opts, cfield, font=None, blueprint=None)¶

Bases: object

draw()¶
class pypoints.Point(char, x, y, cfield, font=None, active=True)¶

Bases: object

The core foundation of the PyPoints module. It is a single character on the terminal window.

Parameters

  • char (string) – The character of the point.

  • x (int) – The x position on the window

  • y (int) – The y position on the window

  • cfield (int) – The field that the point is displayed on

  • font (Font) – (optional) The Font of the point

  • active (bool) – (optional) (default True) If active is False, then the point is not registered, and therefore not displayed. Use Point.activate() to register and display the point

Example

point = Point("a", 3, 5, 0, font)

See also

Font, Text

Warning

More than one character on parameter char will break PyPoints. Please use Text for multi-character points.

activate()¶

Activate, display, and register the point if active was False

draw(win)¶

This method is used by PointRegistry and Run().

Note

There is no need to call this function

See also

PointRegistry, Run()

remove(kill=False)¶

Removes the point from the registry

Parameters

kill (bool) – (optional) (default False) Deletes the point. Any subsequent calls or references to the point will fail because the point no longer exists.

Warning

This action is irreversable

  • x (int) – x position

  • font (Font) – (optional) The font of the points in the line

See also

pypoints.log(txt)¶

Outputs argument txt to pypointslog.txt

Parameters

txt (object) – The object outputted to the log file

Example

log('Hello!')

log({'foo': 'bar'})
pypoints.run(r)¶

Runs the “pre” and “run” method from argument r. These methods are where the program code goes

Parameters

r (object) – The class that is run

  • r.pre(win)

    Run before anything else. Initialize any objects here

  • r.run(win)

    Main program code goes here. Once it finishes, it get ran again

Example

class program():
    def pre(self, win):
        self.color = Color(green, black)
        self.font = Font()
        self.point = Point("a", 0, 0, 0)
    def run(self, win):
        if win.getkey == "c":
            return False
r = program()
run(r)
